openadk.library.policy
Class ADKDefaultPolicy

java.lang.Object
  openadk.library.policy.PolicyFactory
      openadk.library.policy.ADKDefaultPolicy

public class ADKDefaultPolicy
extends PolicyFactory

Represents the default policy engine used by the ADK. Policy is controlled by entries in the agent's XML configuration file or default policy.

Policy entries can be set at the Agent, Template, or Zone level in the agent's configuration file. If the AgentConfig class is not used to configure the agent, this class provides default policies prescribed by the ADK.

Here is an example of setting request policy using the agent configuration file. The <Policy> element can be placed using a zone, template or agent node in the config file. 

 <policy>
 <!-- Set the policies for requesting data-->
 <requestpolicy>
        <object name="*">
          <!-- For all objects, request data using SIF 1.5r1-->
          <version>1.5r1</version>
        </object>
        <object name="Assessment">
          <!-- Override the default policy for the Assessment object and request it
                using 2.* and using a specific source id -->
          <version>2.*</version>
          <sourceId>AssessmentAgent</sourceId>
        </object>
   </requestpolicy>
 </policy>

Version:
ADK 2.1
Author:
Andrew Elmhorst

Description copied from class: PolicyFactory
Returns the ObjectRequestyPolicy for the specified SIF Data Object

Specified by:
getRequestPolicy in class PolicyFactory
Parameters:
zone - The zone to get policy information for
objectName - The name of the SIF Data Object for which to return request policy
Returns:
An instance of ObjectRequestPolicy that has been initialized to prescribe policy for requesting data of that type or null if no policy is defined
